Package space.sunqian.fs.base.string

Interface NameFormatter

public interface NameFormatter
Name formatter, used to parse or format a given name. A name formatter represents a formatting scheme, such as Camel Case, Snake Case, File Naming, etc.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static interface 
    NameFormatter.Appender
    Appender for appending each word split by tokenize(CharSequence) into the specified Appendable.

  • Method Details

    • lowerCamel

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull NameFormatter lowerCamel()
      Returns a new NameFormatter for lower camel case (e.g. someName). The returned instance applies the lower camel case to parse letters in a-z and A-Z, but treats digits (0-9) and other characters as separate words.
      Returns:
      a new NameFormatter for lower camel case (e.g. someName)

    • upperCamel

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull NameFormatter upperCamel()
      Returns a new NameFormatter for upper camel case (e.g. SomeName), also called pascal case. The returned instance applies the upper camel case to parse letters in a-z and A-Z, but treats digits (0-9) and other characters as separate words.
      Returns:
      a new NameFormatter for upper camel case (e.g. SomeName)

    • delimiterCase

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull NameFormatter delimiterCase(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence delimiter) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new NameFormatter base on the specified delimiter (e.g. some-name, some_name).
      Parameters:
      delimiter - the specified delimiter
      Returns:
      a new NameFormatter base on the specified delimiter (e.g. some-name, some_name)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the delimiter is empty

    • delimiterCase

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull NameFormatter delimiterCase(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence delimiter, @Nonnull NameFormatter.Appender appender) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns a new NameFormatter base on the specified delimiter (e.g. some-name, some_name).
      Parameters:
      delimiter - the specified delimiter, can not be empty
      appender - the appender used to append each word into the destination appendable object
      Returns:
      a new NameFormatter base on the specified delimiter (e.g. some-name, some_name)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the delimiter is empty

    • fileNaming

      @Nonnull static @Nonnull NameFormatter fileNaming()
      Returns a new NameFormatter used to separate file base name and file extension (e.g. some-name.txt split to some-name and txt).
      Returns:
      a new NameFormatter used to separate file base name and file extension (e.g. some-name.txt split to some-name and txt)

    • simpleAppender

      @Nonnull static NameFormatter.Appender simpleAppender()
      Returns an instance of NameFormatter.Appender which simply adds the word without any modifications.
      Returns:
      an instance of NameFormatter.Appender which simply adds the word without any modifications

    • parse

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull String @Nonnull [] parse(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence name) throws NameFormatException
      Parses the given name, splits it into an array of words by scheme of this formatter.
      Parameters:
      name - the given name
      Returns:
      an array of words split from the given name
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if failed to parse the given name

    • tokenize

      @Nonnull @Nonnull Span @Nonnull [] tokenize(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence name) throws NameFormatException
      Parses the given name, splits it into an array of words by scheme of this formatter. Returns an array of Spans define the range of each word within the given name.
      Parameters:
      name - the given name
      Returns:
      an array of Spans define the range of each word within the given name
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if failed to parse the given name

    • format

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull String format(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence @Nonnull ... words) throws NameFormatException
      Joins the given words into a name by rules of this name formatter.
      Parameters:
      words - the given words
      Returns:
      a name joined by the given words by rules of this name formatter
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if failed to join the words

    • format

      void format(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence @Nonnull [] words, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst) throws NameFormatException
      Joins the given words into a name by rules of this name formatter. The joined name will be appended to the specified destination appendable.
      Parameters:
      words - the given words
      dst - the specified destination appendable
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if failed to join the words

    • format

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull String format(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence originalName, @Nonnull @Nonnull Span @Nonnull [] wordSpans) throws NameFormatException
      Joins the words into a name by rules of this name formatter. The words are specified by the array of Span that define the range of each word within the given original name.
      Parameters:
      originalName - the given original name where the word spans are derived
      wordSpans - the array of Span that define the range of each word within the given original name
      Returns:
      a name joined from the words by rules of this name formatter
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if failed to join the words

    • format

      void format(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence originalName, @Nonnull @Nonnull Span @Nonnull [] wordSpans, @Nonnull @Nonnull Appendable dst) throws NameFormatException
      Joins the words into a name by rules of this name formatter. The words are specified by the array of Span that define the range of each word within the given original name. The joined name will be appended to the specified destination appendable.
      Parameters:
      originalName - the given original name where the word spans are derived
      wordSpans - the array of Span that define the range of each word within the given original name
      dst - the specified destination appendable
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if failed to join the words

    • format

      @Nonnull default @Nonnull String format(@Nonnull @Nonnull CharSequence name, @Nonnull @Nonnull NameFormatter otherFormatter) throws NameFormatException
      Converts the given name from this name formatter to the other specified name formatter. This method is equivalent to: otherFormatter.format(name, tokenize(name)).
      Parameters:
      name - the given name
      otherFormatter - the other specified name formatter
      Returns:
      the converted name
      Throws:
      NameFormatException - if the conversion is not supported for the given name
